content.prompt: Which of the following conclusions about the economic and political structure of Great Britain is best supported by the passage?

choices.label: Imperial expansion was extremely unpopular among British elites.
In spite of parliamentary reforms, radical political revolution was widely supported by the bourgeoisie.
Mercantilist economic policies were widely supported by the British working class.
Despite changes brought about by industrialization, landed elites still retained significant power.

topic.text: 6.5: The Concert of Europe and European Conservatism
